DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: Were previously configured for All Languages/Technologies, now only configured for SQL technologies: ABAP, DB2 Server, Forms, Microsoft T-SQL, PL/SQL, SQL Server, Sybase T-SQL

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid Artifacts with High Fan-Out
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: After an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.0, a subsequent re-analysis of source code and a snapshot generation you may find that the number of objects violating the Avoid Artifacts with High Fan-Out - 7778 Quality Rule decreases. This is due to a change in the SQL procedure that calculates the Quality Rule: inherit links are no longer included in the calculation, therefore less links are considered in the scope of the Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Use lazy fetching for collection
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: Due to the support of Hibernate 4/JPA 2.0, collections of Basic or Embeddable types are supported. Therefore after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.0, a subsequent re-analysis of source code and a snapshot generation you may find that the number of violations for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid table and column names that are too long (portability)
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: Due to the support of Hibernate 4/JPA 2.0, collections of Basic or Embeddable types are supported. Therefore after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.0, a subsequent re-analysis of source code and a snapshot generation you may find that the number of violations for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid database tables associated to more than one Entity
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: Due to the support of Hibernate 4/JPA 2.0, collections of Basic or Embeddable types are supported. Therefore after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.0, a subsequent re-analysis of source code and a snapshot generation you may find that the number of violations for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Use of style sheets
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: In previous releases of CAST AIP, some code was being reported as violating the Quality Rule Use of style sheets - 2230, despite the fact that a .CSS file was being specified in the code. These false positives have now been corrected and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.x, a subsequent re-analysis of source code and a snapshot generation you may find that the number of violations for the Quality Rule decreases.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Pages should use error handling page
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: In previous releases of CAST AIP, some JSP files were being reported as violating the Quality Rule Pages should use error handling page, despite the fact that a errorpage tag reference was specified in the code. These false positives have now been corrected and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.x, a subsequent re-analysis of source code and a snapshot generation you may find that the number of violations for the Quality Rule decreases.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Serialize session objects
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: In previous releases of CAST AIP, some code was incorrectly being reported as violating the Quality Rule Serialize session objects - 7444. These false positives have now been corrected and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.x, a subsequent re-analysis of source code and a snapshot generation you may find that the number of violations for the Quality Rule decreases.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: JSP pages should always be accessed through their tiles definition
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: In previous releases of CAST AIP, code that was violating the Quality Rule JSP pages should always be accessed through their tiles definition - 7148 was not reported as a violation. This bug has now been corrected and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.x, a subsequent re-analysis of source code and a snapshot generation you may find that the number of violations for the Quality Rule increases.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid using specific logging implementation
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: Due to a change in the way J2EE Analysis Units containing differing analysis configurations are analyzed in CAST AIP 8.0.x - all in one Execution Unit rather than in multiple Execution Units (see http://doc.castsoftware.com/display/DOC80/Changes+in+results+post+upgrade+-+8.0.0#Changesinresultspostupgrade-8.0.0-AU) - you may find that after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.x, a subsequent re-analysis of source code and a snapshot generation, the number of violations for the Quality Rule changes (there may be more or less violations). These removed and added violations are all positive improvements, in other words the list of violations is more accurate than in previous releases of CAST AIP.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Blocking synchronous calls should have associated timeouts

These removed and added violations are all positive improvements, in other words the list of violations is more accurate than in previous releases of CAST AIP.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: The exception Exception should never been thrown. Always Subclass Exception and throw the subclassed Classes
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: Due to the introduction of a brand new .NET analyzer the Quality Rule "The exception Exception should never been thrown. Always Subclass Exception and throw the subclassed Classes - 7824" will produce more accurate results than in previous releases of CAST AIP. Therefore after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.0, a subsequent re-analysis of source code and a snapshot generation you may find that the number of violations for this Quality Rule decrease.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid Superclass (or Interface) knowing Subclass (or Interface)
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: In previous releases of CAST AIP, Interfaces were excluded from the scope (only classes were taken into account). This has now been rectified, and "Avoid Superclass (or Interface) knowing Subclass (or Interface) - 7934" will produce more accurate results than in previous releases of CAST AIP. Therefore after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.0, a subsequent re-analysis of source code and a snapshot generation you may find that the number of violations for this Quality Rule increases.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Controls naming convention - prefix, case and character set control
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: In previous releases of CAST AIP, VB.NET controls are resolved as objects in their own right, however, in CAST AIP 8.0.0, some of these objects are now resolved as properties. Therefore after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.0, a subsequent re-analysis of source code and a snapshot generation you may find that the number of violations for this Quality Rule changes.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid using Keywords as names
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: The Quality Rule Avoid using Keywords as names - 3570 is new in CAST AIP 8.0.x. Therefore after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.x, a subsequent re-analysis of source code and a snapshot generation you may find that the global number of violations may change.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid Artifacts with High Integration Complexity
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: In previous releases of CAST AIP, the Avoid Artifacts with High Integration Complexity - 7774 Quality Rule was not calculated correctly. This issue has now been resolved. Therefore after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.x, a subsequent re-analysis of source code and a snapshot generation you may find that the number of violations for this Quality Rule changes.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid empty catch blocks
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: In previous releases of CAST AIP, a violation of the Avoid empty catch blocks - 7788 Quality Rule would produce a bookmark on the entire artifact. This behaviour has changed in CAST AIP: bookmarks are placed on the catch and finally blocks, to make the violation more accurate.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Number of code lines
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: If your .NET project contains ASP.NET code, you may find that after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.x, a subsequent re-analysis of source code and a snapshot generation you may find that the number of lines of code has increased. This is due to a change in the way code generated from ASP files are considered by the .NET analyzer.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Close SQL connection ASAP
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: In previous releases of CAST AIP, this Quality Rule was only implemented for VB.NET technology. In CAST AIP 8.0.x, the Quality Rule now also functions for C# and is set as Critical. As such, after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.x, a subsequent re-analysis of source code and a snapshot generation you may find that you have more critical violations for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid String concatenation in loops
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: In previous releases of CAST AIP, this Quality Rule was set as Critical for both the VB.NET and C# technologies. In CAST AIP 8.0.x, the Quality Rule is now set as non-Critical. As such, after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.x, a subsequent re-analysis of source code and a snapshot generation you will find that - 1. the overall number of Critical violations decreases. 2. violations for the Quality Rule itself will no longer be flagged as Critical.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid unchecked return code (SQLCODE) after EXEC SQL query
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: The Quality Rule Avoid unchecked return code (SQLCODE) after EXEC SQL query - 7690 was previously and erroneously set to "non-critical". In CAST AIP 8.0.x this has been fixed and the Quality Rule is now set correctly to "critical". Therefore after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.x, a subsequent re-analysis of source code and a snapshot generation you may find that the grades for this Quality Rule change.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Number of Commented Code Lines
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: After an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.x from any CAST AIP 7.3.x release, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid Artifacts with high Commented-out Code Lines/Code Lines ratio
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: After an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.x from any CAST AIP 7.3.x release, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid Too Many Copy Pasted Artifacts
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: After an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.x from any CAST AIP 7.3.x release, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid SQL queries that no index can support
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been detected that is causing the rule "Avoid SQL queries that no index can support" (7422) to produce false negatives if the rule "Avoid SQL queries not using the first column of a composite index in the WHERE clause" (7428) is violated. This bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.2 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid directly instantiating a Class used as a Spring bean
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been detected that is causing the rule "Avoid directly instantiating a Class used as a Spring bean" (7964) to produce erroneous results: violations are being detected on Java Methods, whereas the "total" value for this Quality Rule is detected on Spring Beans leading to situations where the total number of checks is less than the number of failed checks for this Quality Rule. This bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.2 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Private Fields naming convention - case and character set control
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been detected that is causing the rules listed above to produce erroneous results: the total number of checks is always less than the number of failed checks. This bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.2 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Public Fields naming convention - case and character set control
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been detected that is causing the rules listed above to produce erroneous results: the total number of checks is always less than the number of failed checks. This bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.2 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Events naming convention - case and character set control
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been detected that is causing the rules listed above to produce erroneous results: the total number of checks is always less than the number of failed checks. This bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.2 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid using Fields (non static final) from other Classes
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been detected that is causing the rule "Avoid using Fields (non static final) from other Classes" (4602) to produce false positives: violations are being detected when the source code uses fields from a parent Class. This bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.2 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid SQL queries not using the first column of a composite index in the WHERE clause
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been detected that is causing the rule "Avoid SQL queries not using the first column of a composite index in the WHERE clause" (7428) to produce false negatives despite the fact that a Cobol paragraph does a select on a column that is not the first column of the index. This bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.2 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid Namespaces with High Efferent Coupling (CE)
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been detected that is causing the rules listed above to produce erroneous results: the query used to compute the total number of namespaces was incorrect and instead the total number of classes was being calculated. This was leading to situations where the total number of checks was less than the number of failed checks for these Quality Rules. This bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.3 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rules.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid namespaces with High Afferent Coupling (CA)
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been detected that is causing the rules listed above to produce erroneous results: the query used to compute the total number of namespaces was incorrect and instead the total number of classes was being calculated. This was leading to situations where the total number of checks was less than the number of failed checks for these Quality Rules. This bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.3 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rules.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid using references to the id in the persistent class's method equals()
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been detected that is causing the rule listed above to produce false positive violations when the source code contains an id that is natural (i.e. not containing the annotation @generatedValue). This bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.3 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid improper processing of the execution status of data handling operation
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been detected that is causing the rule listed above to produce false positive violations when the source code contains a try...catch clause with a throw statement. The throw was incorrectly considered as "improper processing" causing the Quality Rule to be violated. This bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.3 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid SQL queries with implicit conversions in the WHERE clause
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been detected that is causing the rule listed above to produce erroneous total checks vs. failed checks results: the number of failed checks was higher than the number of total checks. This bug was due to a configuration issue in the Quality Rule calculation and it has now been fixed. After an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.3 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid artifacts having recursive calls
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: In the context of a PL/SQL analysis, a bug was detected that caused the rule listed above to produce false positive violations when an overloaded function was used. The analyzer did not correctly understand a situation where a procedure is calling another procedure with the same name, but a different parameter. This bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.3 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid SQL queries with implicit conversions in the WHERE clause
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been detected that is causing the rule listed above to produce erroneous results. This bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.4 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid SQL queries not using the first column of a composite index in the WHERE clause
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been detected in previous releases of CAST AIP where violations of the above Quality Rule were incorrectly flagged (artifacts are flagged as violating the Quality Rule even though they do in fact use an index). This bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.4 and the generation of a new snapshot, you may find that the number of violations for this Quality Rule changes.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid unchecked return code (SQLCODE) after EXEC SQL query
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: In previous releases of CAST AIP the Quality Rule listed above was not able to correctly handle EVALUATE/WHEN and IF (when a MOVE command is inserted before the EXEC-SQL) clauses causing false positive violations. This bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.4 and the generation of a new snapshot, you may find that Quality Rule results are different.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid unchecked return code (SY-SUBRC) after AUTHORITY-CHECK
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: Improvements have been made to the algorithm that calculates the above Quality Rule and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.4 and the generation of a new snapshot, you may find that there are less violations for this Quality Rule. This is an improvement: violations are no longer flagged when the statement is in a CASE...WHEN and the CHECK statement is just after the CASE...WHEN.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Methods must have appropriate JavaDoc @exception tags
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been discovered which has meant that objects containing JavaDoc @throws tags are being incorrectly flagged as violating the Quality Rule "Methods must have appropriate JavaDoc @exception tags - 4678". The bug has now been fixed (@throws are now correctly detected) and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.5 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Provide accessors to Private Fields
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been discovered in the way that this Quality Rule is calculated, which can lead to false violations of the rule (private fields that do contain accessors are still violating the rule). The bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.5 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid Classes with a High Lack of Cohesion
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been discovered which has meant that Java Enums are included in the scope of objects considered by the Quality Rule "Avoid Classes with a High Lack of Cohesion - 7798". The bug has now been fixed (Java Enums have been removed from the scope) and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.5 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid types that own disposable fields and are not disposable
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been detected which is causing Brushes classes to wrongly violate the Quality Rule "Avoid types that own disposable fields and are not disposable - 8086". This bug has now been fixed (Brushes are no excluded from the scope of this Quality Rule) and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.5 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule - you may see less violations.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Check alphanumeric data before moving it into numeric data
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been detected which is causing the false violation of the Quality Rule "Check alphanumeric data before moving it into numeric data - 8030". The Quality Rule was falsely being violated when the syntax "pic x(01)" is used and "x" is written in lowercase. This bug has now been fixed (the Quality Rule will correctly interpret the use of lowercase "x") and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.5 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule - you may see less violations.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid SQL queries that no index can support
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been detected which is causing the false violation of the Quality Rule "Avoid SQL queries that no index can support - 7902". The Quality Rule is falsely being violated when indexes covering the queries exist. This bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.5 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule - you may see less violations.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid Too Many Copy Pasted Artifacts
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been discovered in the way that this Quality Rule is calculated, which can lead to false violations of the rule (the number of failed checks may exceed the total number of checks). The bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.5 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Controls must inherit from a userobject
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been discovered in the way that this Quality Rule is calculated, which can lead to false violations of the rule (objects that already inherit from a userobject are being flagged as violations). The bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.5 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid accessing SAP standard Tables in modification from custom code
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been discovered which has meant that CAST considers SAP tables with the prefix "pa9" and "hrp9" to be "standard" tables. However, this is contrary to the SAP recommendations. These tables are therefore falsely violating the Quality Rule "Avoid accessing SAP standard Tables in modification from custom code". The bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.5 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid using EXIT statement in Include
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been discovered which has meant that EXIT statements located in a Form within an include are falsely violating the Quality Rule. The bug has now been fixed (EXIT statements located in a Form within an include will not violate the Quality Rule) and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.0.5 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: In previous releases of CAST AIP, this Quality Rule was flagged as critical. To align the rule with other similar rules in JEE and .NET (C#) which are not flagged as critical, the 7518 rule is no longer flagged as critical.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Casting from pointer to base class to pointer to derived class should be done through dynamic_cast or static_cast

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid having multiple Artifacts inserting data on the same SQL Table
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: In previous releases of CAST AIP, a bug was causing DB2 UDB source code to be incorrectly classified as both DB2 UDB and DB2 z/OS source code. The effects of this were that certain Quality Rules were detecting a falsely inflated number of violations, and the Number of Code Lines value was showing double the actual number of code lines (the source code was counted twice, once for DB2 UDB and once for DB2 z/OS).

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Track Classes referencing Database objects
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: This Quality Rule has been improved in CAST AIP 8.1 to take into account more dynamic links when checking for links to the database layer. For example: there may be an increase in the number of false positives returned by the rule, which can be removed by cleaning up the invalid dynamic links using the Dynamic Link Manager

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Good use of Interfaces with collections as Method return types
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug that was introduced in CAST AIP 8.0.1 has been discovered in CAST AIP 8.1. It has unfortunately not been possible to fix this bug in CAST AIP 8.1.x

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid using Vector
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: These Quality Rules have been improved in CAST AIP 8.1. There may be an increase in the number of violations returned

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid using Hashtable
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: These Quality Rules have been improved in CAST AIP 8.1. There may be an increase in the number of violations returned

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Track Classes referencing Database objects
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: An improvement has been made to CAST AIP to increase accuracy: SQL code embedded in Java interface definitions (in string variables) is now detected for the Track Classes referencing Database objects (4722) Quality Rule. There may be an increase in violations due to the improved accuracy.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid using specific logging implementation
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: Due to a change in the way J2EE Analysis Units containing differing analysis configurations are analyzed in CAST AIP 8.1.x - all in one Execution Unit rather than in multiple Execution Units . These removed and added violations are all positive improvements, in other words the list of violations is more accurate than in previous releases of CAST AIP

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid using deprecated objects
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: Due to a change in the way J2EE Analysis Units containing differing analysis configurations are analyzed in CAST AIP 8.1.x - all in one Execution Unit rather than in multiple Execution Units . DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid artifacts having recursive calls
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been fixed that was causing false positive violations to be reported for the Quality Rule "Avoid artifacts having recursive calls - 7388": some code was wrongly being interpreted as recursive causing the false violation of the Quality Rule. The bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.1.1 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid using references to the id in the persistent class's method equals()
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been detected that is causing the rule listed above to produce false positive violations when the source code contains an id that is natural (i.e. not containing the annotation @generatedValue). This bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.1.1 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid improper processing of the execution status of data handling operation
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been detected that is causing the rule listed above to produce false positive violations when the source code contains a try...catch clause with a throw statement. The throw was incorrectly considered as "improper processing" causing the Quality Rule to be violated. This bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.1.1 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid hardcoded network resource names
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been fixed that was causing false positive violations to be reported for the Quality Rule "Avoid hardcoded network resource names - 8102": the string "SQLException:\n" was being misinterpreted as a network resource because of ":\" and causing the false violation of the Quality Rule. The bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.1.1 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid using COMPUTE statement for elementary arithmetic operation
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been fixed that was causing false positive violations to be reported for the Quality Rule "Avoid using COMPUTE statement for elementary arithmetic operation - 7754" when the operands in the COMPUTE statement were not using parentheses. The bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.1.1 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid SQL queries with implicit conversions in the WHERE clause
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been detected that is causing the rule listed above to produce erroneous total checks vs. failed checks results: the number of failed checks was higher than the number of total checks. This bug was due to a configuration issue in the Quality Rule calculation and it has now been fixed. After an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.1.1 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid using SQL queries inside a loop
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been discovered which has resulted in false negatives (i.e. violations are expected but not found) for the Quality Rule "Avoid using SQL queries inside a loop - 7424" when the analysis involves JEE (the class simpleJDBCTemplateSpring from the Framework 3.0) and SQL. The bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.1.2 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule, i.e. there will be an increased number of violations (improved accuracy). The fix also brings improved accuracy : additional client/server links between Java methods using the simpleJDBC API and SQL components (these were not previously detected), and increased Function Point count (higher DET/RET values for existing transactions, and increased numbers of transactions, which were not detected previously)

This bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.1.2 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule - there will be less violations due to improved accuracy of the Quality Rules.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid accessing SAP standard Tables in modification from custom code
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been discovered which has meant that CAST considers SAP tables with the prefix "pa9" and "hrp9" to be "standard" tables. However, this is contrary to the SAP recommendations. These tables are therefore falsely violating the Quality Rule "Avoid accessing SAP standard Tables in modification from custom code". The bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.1.2 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid using EXIT statement in Include
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been discovered which has meant that EXIT statements located in a Form within an include are falsely violating the Quality Rule. The bug has now been fixed (EXIT statements located in a Form within an include will not violate the Quality Rule) and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.1.2 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Check alphanumeric data before moving it into numeric data
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been detected which is causing the false violation of the Quality Rule "Check alphanumeric data before moving it into numeric data - 8030". The Quality Rule was falsely being violated when the syntax "pic x(01)" is used and "x" is written in lowercase. This bug has now been fixed (the Quality Rule will correctly interpret the use of lowercase "x") and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.1.3 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule - you may see less violations.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid SQL queries that no index can support
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been detected which is causing the false violation of the Quality Rule "Avoid SQL queries that no index can support - 7902". The Quality Rule is falsely being violated when indexes covering the queries exist. This bug has now been fixed and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.1.3 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule - you may see less violations.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid types that own disposable fields and are not disposable
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: A bug has been detected which is causing Brushes classes to wrongly violate the Quality Rule "Avoid types that own disposable fields and are not disposable - 8086". This bug has now been fixed (Brushes are no excluded from the scope of this Quality Rule) and after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.1.3 and the generation of a post upgrade snapshot, results may differ for this Quality Rule - you may see less violations.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: In previous releases of CAST AIP, the Quality Rules listed above were not functioning correctly and were producing false negative results. The algorithm used to generate these Quality Rules has now been improved and corrected and, after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.2.x and the generation of a new snapshot, the number of violations may increase. This increase in violations is due to the improved accuracy provided by the bug correction. In addition, although many "paths" may exist for each violation (a violation is deemed to be a "path" that starts in a loop in a method and targets an object) the Quality Rules will now only report one "path", thus keeping the Quality Rule calculation time stable and reducing the amount of data produced.

This increase in violations is due to the improved accuracy provided by the bug correction. In addition, although many "paths" may exist for each violation (a violation is deemed to be a "path" that starts in a loop in a method and targets an object) the Quality Rules will now only report one "path", thus keeping the Quality Rule calculation time stable and reducing the amount of data produced.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Avoid directly instantiating a Class used as a Managed bean
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: In previous releases of CAST AIP, the Quality Rule listed above functioned only on Spring beans. In CAST AIP 8.2.x, this behaviour has been improved: it now functions with all framework beans supported by CAST AIP (Struts, CDI, Jsf, Hibernate etc.). As such, after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.2.x and the generation of a new snapshot on existing source code, the number of violations may increase for this Quality Rule.

DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_NAME: Provide accessors to Private Fields
DELTA_QR_EXPLANATIONS.QR_DELTA_EXPLANATION: In previous releases of CAST AIP this Quality Rule would be violated if injected fields of classes managed by a framework such as Struts, CDI, JSF, Hibernate etc. did not include a setter. This requirement for a setter in this particular circumstance has now been removed from the Quality Rule. As such, after an upgrade to CAST AIP 8.2.x and the generation of a new snapshot on existing source code, the number of violations may change for this Quality Rule.
